availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Son of Elizabeth Cook. Married to Sophia M. Cobb Cook in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on July 13, 1844. Father of Thomas Cook, John Cook, Isaac R. Cook, Otis Cook, Ella Cook, William Cook, and Richard E. Cook. Merchant in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hickman County in 1850. Merchant in Hickman County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hickman County in 1860. Household owned an additional five enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 423A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film 000851644.
